sen.j: 熊坂長範（くまさか ちょうはん）は、平安時代の伝説上の盗賊。
sen.e: Chohan KUMASAKA is a legendary thief who is said to have lived during the Heian period.
Chohan KUMASAKA was a legendary thief who was said to have lived during the Heian period.
Chohan KUMASAKA was a legendary thief who was said to have lived during the Heian period.
He is said to have been from Kumasaka, Echigo Province.
sen.cmt: 伝説上の人物ということで、「越後国熊坂出身とされている」という意味になるよう訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was said to have been from Kumasaka, Echigo Province.
He was said to have been from Kumasaka, Echigo Province.

sen.j: 牛若丸が金売吉次にともなわれて奥州へ下る途中、これを美濃国赤坂宿 (中山道)で襲ったが、かえって牛若丸に討たれたという。
sen.e: It is said that he attacked Ushiwakamaru at Akasaka-shuku Stage, Mino Province while Ushiwakamaru was heading toward Oshu (Mutsu Province) accompanied by Kichiji KANEURI, but Chohan was eventually defeated by Ushiwakamaru.
sen.cmt: 原文に「美濃国赤坂宿 (中山道)」とございますが、リンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し「美濃赤坂宿」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: It was said that he attacked Ushiwakamaru at Akasaka-jyuku Station, Mino Province while Ushiwakamaru was heading towards Oshu (Mutsu Province) accompanied by Kichiji KANEURI, but Chohan was eventually defeated by Ushiwakamaru.
sen.cmt: 赤坂宿を検索すると、中山道の場合は「あかさかじゅく」とされている場合の方が多いようです。http://www.rurubu.com/event/detail.aspx?ID=10585Akasaka-syuku Stageとありますが、Station の方が良いと思います。過去形になります。towardsです。
sen.e: It was said that he attacked Ushiwakamaru at Akasaka-jyuku Station, Mino Province while Ushiwakamaru was heading towards Oshu (Mutsu Province) accompanied by Kichiji KANEURI, but Chohan was eventually defeated by Ushiwakamaru.

sen.j: 能や歌舞伎に脚色された。
sen.e: People have adopted his story for Noh and Kabuki performances.
People have adopted his story for both Noh and Kabuki performances.
sen.cmt: bothをつけた方が良いと思います。
sen.e: People have adopted his story for both Noh and Kabuki performances.
